name: Kentucky Vietnam Veterans Memorial
address: 365 Vernon Cooper Ln, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: The memorial is nice, but the time is off about 2 hours. Would be a great place to visit for veterans and their families. Not much else to see here.
As a vet, I love coming upon places like this while travelling. Very nicely done.
Beautiful and scenic memorial. Definitely worth the side trip off the interstate. I'd love to see it at night, but the sunny day view was also great!
Went there for the Run For The Wall, it was an great experience to see the clock as well as so many people come together...

I rode across country from Los Angeles to DC to support veterans, we stopped here along our way.
Really beautiful memorial. 
The staff here were very friendly and welcoming.
I really enjoyed this Memorial even though I served many many years after Vietnam
This was a real treat to come here and visit

name: Salato Wildlife Center
reviews: My kids and I love it here! There is all kinds of animals to see. They have educational activities and events for adults and children both. They have multiple stocked fishing ponds. They have nice hiking trails with a map. The price of admission is affordable and fair. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I highly recommend checking out the Salato Center if you have never been.
This was way better than i was expecting! Lots of information, lots of animals, and plenty of outside time. Definitely worth a visit!

I’ve gone here since I was a kid and loved bringing my nephews here. Some things have been added which is nice but as nature may go, I was sad to see the dragonfly marsh pretty much dried up. That was one of my favorite spots as a child. Great place to go to see some interesting animals and learn a lot.

Loved this experience. It's not overwhelming and very beautiful and educational. The entrance fee isn't much and they have plenty opportunity for walking trails.  All the animals were outside and playing and the streams were gorgeous!

The price is reasonable and it is an educational for kids of all ages. It isn't a zoo so don't expect a large variety of exotic animals it is filled with local wildlife. It makes a nice day especially if you pack a meal and a fishing pole for trip.

name: Kentucky History Center & Museums
address: 100 W Broadway St, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: Our visit started off just right with free parking across the street. Admission covered this building and the state military history museum up the hill a few block away. Get there in time for a tour of the Old State Capitol building for the history of Frankfort and KY. The 200 yr history of the state will take at least 1 1/2 hrs to get it all in.
Learned a lot about history it was such a blessing and got to look up my grandfathers serving in the army
For anyone interested in a juvenile education of Kentucky or to take your children to learn about the state ... great!!!
Friendly and helpful staff. Museum was bigger than I expected. I would definitely recommend this place. There's a little area for little kids to play and they also have a gift shop.
We went there to get our tickets for the old capitol tour, amazing. Meanwhile we used the time to ejoy that museum,great

name: Buffalo Trace Distillery
address: 113 Great Buffalo Trace, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: What an amazing distillery. It just has so much character. Did the hard hat tour and loved it. Even my teenage son thought it was cool! I have always loved their bourbons and it was neat to see the process up close.

My wife and I toured Buffalo Trace Distillery this morning.   We arrived about an hour early and were the first two in line.   I was upset at first because there was no EH Taylor in the gift shop.   

Then it was time for our tour.   What a great experience!   And we were blessed to have Freddie as our tour guide.  (Even though he advised me to buy a new hat. (I was wearing my Maker’s hat).   Freddie is very humble and shared some amazing stories with us.  I quickly forgot about the gift shop not being stocked with EH.   We finished the tour with a tasting, I must mention both the tour and tastings are free!   

As I was walking downstairs, back to the gift shop I saw people carrying those beautiful E.H. Taylor cardboard tubes.   I quickly ran to the back and Score...I grabbed one of the last 3 left!  

Perfect day!   

Jason Wachenschwanz
Columbus, Ohio

Buffalo Trace Distillery was by far my favorite place to visit of the three I got a tour of this weekend. The place was amazing and full of sight, what made it more amazing was my tour guide David. He knew American Sign Language and signed the whole time. I understood more about the process from David than from the other places without the accessibility provided. The facts about how large this place is, how big the still and processing tanks are just blows my mind. The other distilleries I visit had tanks in the 7000-7,500ish gal tank, these had up to 9,400 or in that range. I like the fact that they recycled their leftovers and used the “tar” to produce energy for the whole system. **I highly recommend that if you are Deaf, or knows someone that wants to visit Buffalo Trace, to call or email them and request David. He is not an interpreter but does an really good job making sure you understood the history and science of making Bourbon. **

This is an amazing distillery.  I did not do the tour, as time did not allow it.  Their gift shop still took about an hour to peruse through.  Their prices are extremely reasonable for this type of place.  I will definitely stop back and attempt to do the tour.
Such a cool place. Learn a bit of history, take a free tour around the grounds see where the make all the delicious bourbons. It was a dream come true to be able to come visit this place.

name: Floral Clock
reviews: It was a really cool place and it really works, every 5 minutes it moves, I talk to someone that takes care of it and there are few clots like this around the world but this is the only one in the US. It was beautiful.

From the time I was a little boy, I have enjoyed the Floral Clock and tossing coins, making a wish as the coin went into the water. 
My dad would take us riding around town and one of our favorite places would be the Capitol area, I do recall as a youngster, just how the mansion was an eye sore, now it is a beautiful home, a pride of Frankfort.
I have seven children and they all have been to the clock numerous times, all throwing a coin into the water, some of them wishing and those to young just enjoying following suit with their siblings.
To this day, I still find myself riding around with my family and we continue the tradition of heading to our State Capitol Grounds.
Wonderful memories...

If you need a respite from traveling across the state what, take the exit off of I-64 to the Kentucky state capitol in Frankfort magnificent building and complex with this extra special surprise. Beautifully maintained

I enjoyed seeing this beautiful floral clock on Wednesday, June 27, 2018 and on Tuesday, April 3, 2018.

It impressed me to see a large outdoor clock with plants inside it, as it did when I first saw it in 1972 on my eighth grade class trip. During my June visit this year the clock looked magnificent with colorful blooms and greenery. However, the plants did not look that beautiful on the April visit, probably due to it being early in the growing season in Kentucky.

A plaque near the clock provides details about it. And a nice fountain is located below its base that added to the beauty during my June visit. The fountain did not have water in it when I visited in April.

I urge persons in the area to take a few minutes to visit Kentucky's Floral Clock, read the plaque, and take a photo of it. There no charge to view or photograph the clock. Since it is outside in a public area, I guess it can be viewed 24 hours a day. 

The clock is located beside the Kentucky State Capitol Building. I walked from downtown to the capitol building and the clock, but the Frankfort city bus service has a stop near the clock. The bus service runs from early morning to late afternoon Monday-Friday except for holidays, with a more limited schedule on Saturday. It runs once an hour and only costs 25 cents.
This was a neat place. The clock is huge and the flowers look amazing. Very unique place to visit.

name: Old State Capitol Building
address: 300 W Broadway St, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews:
Pretty guided tour we enjoyed lot of history, our guide told us a lot of background stories about almost everything. 
Make sure you get the ticket in time at the visitor center

Was not inside the building.  This is a terrific venue for Friday night concerts over the summer!  Thanks so much for last night and Superfecta even though it was a wash out after their break.  Hope to be back soon!

Very historic building. Too bad those elected to serve there don’t actually represent the people. 
Also, watch out for no hidden no parking signs! I do want to give credit to the 4 of 5 city council members who replied to my email about the parking signs. They were very receptive to the issues I pointed out with the no parking signs covered up by the huge flowering baskets.
Great summer concert.  Must go on the weekends
Great Kentucky landmark. The rotunda staircase is worth the trip alone.

name: State Capitol Building
reviews: I love working at the Capitol of Kentucky. I've worked in all areas of state government and LRC had definitely been my favorite position largely because it is located at one of the most beautiful locations in Frankfort as well as the whole Commonwealth. Please come visit and take a tour or stroll around the grounds. Good times to visit are Christmas to see the beautifully decorated building and springtime to see the tulips and blossoming trees. Make sure to breathe in the perfume of the sweet magnolia blooms. If you go to the floral clock, go around to check out the tropical garden at the back dedicated to Governor Bert Combs.
Beautiful landscape, and building look really nice.  Also there is nice garden with the floral clock that are really nice to take picture with.

Stopped for a quick look while on a trip to Frankfort. My wife and I were up early looking for coffee shops and drove over to see it. Huge, beautiful building. Didn't have time for an inside look. Maybe some other time.
See what has changed in making Kentucky A Great State
This place is magical. Walking in ... Just makes you grateful to be in Kentucky! Proud, beautiful building!

name: Cove Spring Park
address: 100 Cove Spring Rd, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: Had a great time. The hiking was really enjoyable, the trail we took was nice and flat. My knees were very happy.
Beautiful park.  Well kept grounds.  Great walking/hiking.  Crystal clear creeks and waterfalls.

I went with my husband and kids (boys 7 and 9) and we spent an ample amount of time here (couple hours)! We've only been the 1 time, I definitely plan on returning. It was amazing!!! There's plenty more trails to walk, and other places to explore, we plan on spending more time here our next trip.
Beutiful place. Great for kids. Can't Wait to go back when the weather is warmer.
Best park in Frankfort ky... I love it here... walking trails and sitting areas... water fall... so peaceful

name: Leslie Morris Park at Fort Hill
reviews: I love this place very peaceful and relaxing and it has a lot of historical parts so if you are interested in history you for sure will love this place
Hours shown are for visitor center only. Park is open everyday, from sun up to sun down. Gorgeous place to hike and wander about. Much of Frankfort is visible from the top of this park.
Kind of an "out of the way" park but there are a few spots with some really great views.

We only walked one of the trails. I believe there are more. There's a house from the 1800's you can go in some times and the guide tells you about life in the past and the civil war in Frankfort.  When another group of people came in our guide simply turned away from us and started guiding them. We guess our tour was over. Odd guy. There's a fantastic view of the city on the trail. Well maintained trails. Kids didn't like it.

Its a really tranquil place to hike up to, and it most certainly takes some exercise  to get up there. 

 It is a fort from the civil war.

name: Liberty Hall
reviews: The gardens were absolutely beautiful, worth checking out
Historic and supposedly haunted
So pretty!
Checking out some history
Wedding venue

name: Governor's Mansion
reviews: The Governor's Mansion was a very beautiful and unique place. It is full of interesting history. It was very nice of Governor Matt Bevin to invite us to see and learn about it. The behind the scenes tour was a great and unexpected surprise. The Infinity mirrors we're were a great touch. I would recommend going to see and learning about the Governor's Mansion.
A very nice house (from the outside). I didn't get to see much of it, as it was Saturday and there was no possibility of getting a tour.
Was invited there on behalf of the Red Cross.  The staff were friendly and Governor spoke very well and was warmly welcoming.  Very historic.

After visiting the Capitol building on the weekend, we came back on a Tuesday to tour he mansion. Unfortunately we thought the last tour left at 11, but it actually left at 10:30! The world's nicest lady took us around anyways and we had our own private tour, which was simply amazing. This building has lots of rich history. It was a great time and we were lucky their staff is so nice.
Very beautiful ✨my daughter loves the clock🕣 and all the pretty flowers 🌷🌼🌺🌹

name: Capitol View Park
address: Corner of St Hwy 676 & Glenn's Creek Road, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: Definitely love this park different areas for ball games and also has a park itself and a trail to where you can walk down to the river love going to this park

This is a great mountain bike trail system maintained  by awesome volunteers. You can go ride for 5 minutes at the pump track or 5 hours all over park. There is something for pretty much every skill level. Highly recommend.
Great park. Needs a playground or something for the kids that aren't in a sporting event that's going on.
Compact 9 miles of variable trails suitable for any skill level. Expert riders may be bored but overall satisfying mix.
This place is beautiful but it needs more tail markers. No real direction for visitors.

name: Capital City Museum
reviews: Awesome collection of historical items and information.

Don't miss your chance to visit the Capital City Museum's newest exhibit "The History of the Bourbon Industry In Frankfort", which opened on April 20, 2018. The exhibit features artifacts from some of the bourbon industry's founding fathers, innovators of the new commonwealth of Kentucky. Also inquire about the NEW Bourbon History Walking Tour as well as the NEW Bourbon History Trolley Tour! All of these activities are FREE of charge.
The tour was great learned a lot about frankforts history

One of the best museums you will ever visit. It is pure Frankfort through and through and you get a great feel for the history of the community. They have the friendliest and nicest staff I've ever met in any museum. They don't mind to chat with you as long as you have a mind to do so. It's clean and uncluttered and everything is thoroughly explained.
I really enjoyed it....the kids have fun too...

name: Kentucky Military History Museum
address: 125 E Main St, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: This museum is included with price of visiting the main KY state museum down the hill. Two stories of military history of KY in the building; oldest displays on the first floor and WW1 and later on 2d floor. The state as well as KY citizens are featured (such as only KY solider awarded Medal of Honor in WW1).  Limited amount of free parking next to building. We took about an hour to tour the exhibits. We are from TX and was impressed with the effort KY put into honoring its state and citizens.
Really cool to visit especially if you a 2and amendment enthusiast.
It was a great place to visit. I have been here previously but my family had not. Interesting for every age in our family and the guys greeting us was extremely nice!
Great place to learn about military history

Little museums like this always turn out to be the best. For the amount of space they have to use I thought the displays and information presented was very good. You probably won't spend a lot of time here but it is worth the stop if you are in town.

name: Daniel Boone's Grave
address: 215 E Main St, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: Best views of the city! They placed him well!
Thanks to Google maps, it is a pretty easy gravesite to find. The maps did get a little confused, so when in doubt go uphill and near the bluff. Daniel has a nice view of the river and state capitol.

Beautiful place, only problem is i was told not to play pokemon go in the cemetery out of respect.. Respect for who i didnt bother anyone and there are over 6 gyms and 25 pokestops in the cemetery lol.. Ask niantic to take them down if you got a problem with people visiting the grave who also enjoy pokemon..
My aunt has indicators for Daniel Boone as relative
Great for tours, and while you visit the kids can play Pokémon Go. More than 30 Pokéstops within the gates. Roads are narrow, so please be careful.

name: Josephine Sculpture Park
reviews: This is truly a hidden gem. An amazing public attraction. Very pleasantly surprised with my visit here. Such an awesome concept and use of the land.

An amazing park with over 70 stunning artworks on 30 acres.  5 trails to walk.  Various events and festivals held here as well through out the year.  Patrons are encouraged to interact with the art. Great for photos.  You can also see native plants and local wildlife.

I was looking for a reason to go for a day trip while at work on a Friday afternoon, and the park was hosting a philharmonic concert the next day on Saturday. The park was inspiring and worth every moment we spent there. It was a hot day and ice cream and snacks were provided for free. 
I've told several people about the park. Everyone should go.
It's a bit of an adventure just trying to find it, but trust your directions and the field opens up to you.

Make sure you bring water bottles in the summer. There are water fountains, but it's more convenient.

I still find myself day dreaming and my mind drifts to the works I visited in the park. Pictures don't do justice to something 20 feet tall that you can touch and spin and stand under. 
Like all good art, you leave with the feeling that your sense of the world has been challenged in some way.
Kentucky has some beautiful and creative places to visit. This park is so nice. I'll be going often. It's free and fun to explore. They have over 70 sculptures there.

I had a great time at this place. I stopped here while on a road trip from Missouri to Virginia. It was the perfect place to stretch my legs and walk around. There were no paved sidewalks, simply open fields, with mowed paths. There were sculptures that encouraged climbing as well as those that requested be left untouched . The paths themselves were wide enough to fit a group of people and enclosed enough to keep the next sculpture more of a reveal; which was nice. 

My son was able to run and burn his energy and I was able to enjoy the art, hopefully instilling an appreciation of it in him as well. 

There’s a donation box near the entrance/exit . I know not many people carry cash but the place is free so leaving what you can helps, I’m sure.

name: Liberty Hall Historic Site
reviews: One of the premier events of Derby Season, Bourbon & Browns at Liberty Hall Historic Site celebrates the historical contributions of the family of Senator John Brown, Kentucky's first US Senator after becoming a state, and the significance of bourbon and it's history in Kentucky. The annual fundraiser benefits the historic Liberty Hall site which includes the Orlando Brown House, Senator John Brown's son, and 4 acres of sprawling gardens. Bourbon tastings, bluegrass music, a live & silent auctions, as well as appetizers and food, cap off the evening and help transport the attendees back to a simpler time in Kentucky's history.

Absolutely a wonderful tour to add to your trip. Our tour guide, Megan was very knowledgeable and very patient with our questions we had! Orlando Brown House is very worth seeing, it's part of the tour. Thank you for having our family!
Bery nice place.
Cool historic site. Supposedly haunted. Former residents have deep political roots in Kentucky history and government.
A Frankfort gem! The gardens aren't as pretty as they used to be? I think they need more volunteers to help!

name: Old Governors Mansion
reviews: Nephew got married here! Hector
We enjoyed ourselves at a beautiful wedding!!
Very cool place had a great time
Amazing home. Older than the white house by one year.
Stunning

name: Lakeview Park
reviews: My family and I love going to this park. It's very close to home. It has great walking trails and a dog park. The grounds are well kept up and during the summer they have a free kids water park and different kinds of events. I highly recommend this park!! Its great for families and their furry friends!!
Great family sports h fun place
Great event for the kids and adults

I've always loved Lakeview Park and the weekend of 9/21, was very hot and sunny but the pavilion where we were was amazing. There was a fabulous breeze and being slightly disabled and unable to walk great distances, the bathrooms were close by. It made our weekend reunion fabulous and hope we get the same place next year.
Nice to see the skate park being remodeled.

name: KY State Capitol
reviews:
This is an excellent place to learn about our state history. You can visit the House and Senate Chambers, when they are not in session. You can watch quietly from the overlook when they are in session.
Check out the collection of first lady dolls!
Beautiful grounds are well manicured and taken care of. Such great photo opportunities for prom or engagement pictures. Tours are available during business hours.
Amazing to see where the state is kept in order and driven forward!!! Can't wait for my sons fifth grade trip next year.
Beautiful capital building, the architecture on the inside is incredible definitely worth a visit and most of the time the public is allowed to tour for free
Beautiful place! I would definitely go back.

name: Frankfort Cemetery
address: 215 E Main St, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: Daniel and Rebecca Boones grave are easily found just follow the yellow line also there is a beautiful war memorial you must visit when here
Not maintained as should be. Office personeal very unprofessional .if you have legitimate issues not addressed correctly.
Beyond breathtaking. Amazing history and gorgeous views over river valley
Was followed and ran off. Thought this was a public place?
Daniel and Rebecca Boones' gravesites are well marked and easy to gain access to. The views are spectacular. Definitely worth the time to visit.

name: River View Park
reviews: It's Frankfort, what can I say?  You get a good view of the Kentucky River.   When the season starts, a farmers market pops up for a few months.  I have bought some real good radishes there.  A pedestrian bridge can take you to the other side of the river where there is another park with trees and another bridge (more for sitting down on a bench and having a smoke; I think that one side of it is fenced-in, i.e., cannot go across).

Nice big dock to fish on or go down there and chill and watch the river.  They have kayaks to rent.  Plenty of parking.  They have walking and biking trails.  I’d highly recommend you to check this place out if you come to Frankfort.  They have to benches on the dock.  A few trees that over hang the dock for some natural shade.
Nice small park.  Workers were modifying to make it even nicer
Very nice discovery while vacationing. My wife and I were up early in the morning and decided to go for a walk and came upon it. We had it all to ourselves.

Nice place to take a scenic walk. They have plaques which you can read and learn a little history and information about the Kentucky river. Farmers market sets up near by. They also have a music festival here very once in a while.

name: Prodigy Vineyards & Winery
reviews: The staff is very friendly.  There are plenty of events for a fun afternoon.  The grounds are pretty. The tasting room is a little cluttered and not too cozy. The wine is overall pretty good. They lean towards a milder, smoother taste. Most interesting though is their port, a very good and unique find in Kentucky.

Such a beautiful place to visit in Kentucky! Right when we pulled into the parking lot, we look to our right and see two beautiful horses, standing in front of the house, that you are allowed to pet (see attached photo). Everyone working there were so kind and helpful. Right when we walked through the door, one of the servers welcomed us and gave us a big hug! They had a huge variety of wines to try so anyone can come relax. 

I had a lovely time thanks to the Prodigy team! Thank you for the memory!
Nice Winery with a wide variety of spirits. Pleasant environment that hosts weddings and special occasions.
Most excellent!! Great wines. Very relaxing!!🍷🍾

Had a great time with our family at Prodigy Vineyards. Enjoyed our wine flights and my chicken salad croissant sandwich was delicious! Best of all was our waitperson, Lorenzo! He was fun and informative.

name: Juniper Hill Park
address: Juniper Hills Park, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: This is a great park! Good amount of seating around playground and nicely shaded... a play area for smaller kids and 2 sets of swings. There's nice pathways for walking and also tennis courts and an area for working out... Plenty of tables for a party too!  Only downfall is no real bathrooms around besides a portable

The park is very nice, but if you have small children beware, they've torn down the playground and left it in a huge pile of rubble.  There is nothing blocking you off from your children going into it and getting hurt. People's negligence baffles me.

My grandson didn't have a place to play because the playground was all roped off.
Repairs were needed in the playground area and it looked as if it's been laying in decay for quite some time.
This is a great place to take your kids to play, there's lots of play equipment, shady places for adults to sit, and picnic tables.
Great playground for the kids and a workout park for the parents. No eggs yet.

name: Buckley Wildlife Sanctuary
reviews: We took the red trail It's well maintained and very manageable for the beginner. This is a quiet woods walk, you hear the many birds and catch glimpses. There are a few openings to expansive fields and some panoramic views. The red trail makers are not clear at some turns because of the unmarked maintenance trails. So bring the trail map. Also my step app clocked this walk closer to 3 miles than one and half. You should not get lost.
This is a nice, quiet place. It has, however, seen better days. When I was there it was in need of maintenance and mowing.

Wonderful, a refuge not only for the wildlife, but also for you. No endless housing sprawl, traffic, noise, and asphalt. Don't get me wrong, I like living in Lexington; but access to this place is priceless. I couldn't stop watching the precious little creatures flitting about sipping water and looking for seeds. Good that it's a bit out of the way; I rather prefer it. Well done, Audubon!
Clean, however I must have gone at the wrong time of year, saw more wildlife on the road getting there than in sanctuary

This is a nice place to come for a walk. There are very few visitors most days. Today there were only three cars when I arrived. I only saw two people on the trails. I hiked the Red Trail today, which is a nice 2 mile walk when combined with the yellow Trail. For a Wildlife Preserve though you see very little wildlife. I saw evidence of owls and heard a woodpecker and heard a few wild birds, but that was it. There is no entrance fee though they suggest a donation of $4. Also the Buckley Wildlife Sanctuary is now run by Life Adventure Center of Woodford County. Basically this is a good place to come if you want to get away from it all for a little while and just have some solitude in nature.
EDIT: Definitely more wildlife now, as Whitetail Deer have come back. I see a few every time I'm out there!

name: Switzer Covered Bridge
reviews: This area is so peaceful. I love to have picnics there. No one bothers you. It is off the beaten path but so worth the drive. They have a beautiful plaque up with the story of the bridge. You are allowed to walk across the bridge which spans the Elkhorn Creek. Popular fishing spot. Always check weather because that area does flood.
Great piece of history. Sad to see how so many have vandalized this beautiful bridge.
Love this place. It's quiet and very pretty
We love going here. It's beautiful. The only downfall was scaring away some people in a car who were obviously doing something they shouldn't have been doing.
Part of Kentucky’s history. Great place to kayak.

name: Kentucky History Museum
address: 100 W Broadway St, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews:
This was our first time to Kentucky so going to the museum was eye opening. Your admission into the place including three other museums and a free tour. Great little gift shop inside and they have an Ale8 machine. This was our first time trying it... I did not know it has caffeine before I let my child try it. 
Great place to spend an afternoon.
It was na lot of interesting stuff. A tour of the old Capital building and an old munitions building filled with military items from many wars.

My daughter was planning to take my young granddaughter here and had to change plans last minute. So it ended up being me and my granddaughter going. I'm really glad I went and got to experience this place. We learned so much and really enjoyed all of the exhibits. Staff were very friendly, helpful, and welcoming. I hope to bring her back when she is a little bit older when she can absorb a little more.

It has been awhile since I went through this museum but from what I remember I know I didn't spend a lot of time here. I do remember thinking it was worth stopping by and I did enjoy walking through seeing the information presented.
Awesome displays. They were doing a lecture series and then had music in the foyer area. Impressed!

name: Woodford Reserve Distillery
reviews: The tour was fantastic and free for military! Our tour guide Leah was super knowledgeable and witty. The history of the grounds and buildings is well preserved. The process is all taking place while you walk through the buildings. They were even bottling while we were taking the tour. The tasting room was really well laid out and the process of “proper” tasting was really interesting. They even give you a piece of chocolate to pair with the three selections. I would highly recommend visiting this local staple!

Sydney provided an amazing tour.  She was informative, entertaining, and very knowledgeable.  Her enthusiasm for her work bubbled through the entire presentation.  The process was fun from start to finish.  The tasting was well presented and have a great sample of the product.  Highly recommend.

This is a Disneyland for adults and modern day of Distillery. Clean, elegant, friendly welcome, excellent whiskey tasting and they know how to make us spend money. If you a old fashion drinker don't forget grabs some of Woodford bitters. Order old fashion you get to keep copper cup.

Nice campus with beautiful scenery surrounding it. Loved the history which was well communicated by the tour guide. Overall a very quaint and bespoke feel. It was a nice tour. The tasting featured 3 whiskey’s (distiller’s select bourbon, double oak bourbon, and rye) and a chocolate. The tasting was a little bit quick for my taste. It would have been nice to slow it down and enjoy a bit more. Staff was super friendly and welcoming. Clean facilities.

Interesting tour that goes into a lot of the smaller things that goes into Woodford reserve to make it stand out from other bourbons. Tour guide was informative. Shuttle bus saves people from walking up and down a lot of steps. Tasting at the end tops off a great tour.

name: Rising Sons Home Farm Winery
reviews: We stopped in this jewel on our way home from a weekend trip to Lexington and we are so happy we did! We were warmly greeted by Francine (co-owner and Joey's wife). We purchased the premier tasting. Francine suggested a couple of wines that were out of our "normal" wine preference and we were pleasantly surprised. She also made a few simple sangrias, which were very simple and delightful. We also had 2 cheeses (with the tasting), which made the tasting complete. The cheeses were delicious! We also had the privilege of tasting several wine jellies, which were just heavenly. We ran into a few, very nice locals, which made for great conversation. Near the end of our tasting, Joey came in and did a toast from his grandfather (and founder), which made our experience even more special. If you are passing through or in the area, please stop in here. You will not be disappointed!

Been wanting to try some Kentucky wine, and my husband and I were lucky enough to stumble upon this winery. The tasting room is located in the house. We were a little hesitant when we stepped out of the vehicle, but were warmly greeted by one of the winery owners, Joey Sloan. The tasting room, like it's owners, was inviting. 
Francine, Joey's wife and co-owner, was helping us with our tastings. We are mostly semi-sweet to sweet wine drinkers, but she convinced us to get out of our comfort zone and try some dry wines too. Mixed a few of the wines with fruit juices to make our own sangria. 
She gave us a nice history of her family and their winery. Francine also makes wine jelly, so we received nice samples of that too. Cheese and cracker platters were also available for purchase. One of the nicest winery experiences I've had in a long time.

Francine and her son were amazing! Best presentation I have ever came across.  From pairing each wine, telling us how to mix different sangria's  and the wine jellies such an awesome experience.  We will be back!

Went here with 8 people and there was plenty of room in the tasting room. Great variety of wines and delcious jams to try and buy. The wines were wonderful and there is something for everyone. The staff is knowledgable and friendly. We also got to meet Bebe who has a wine named after her. Our family had a great time! I highly recommend Rising Sons. We will definately be back.
Had a great time here. The staff is knowledgeable and extremely friendly!!! I will most definitely be returning.

name: Berry Hill Mansion
reviews: Beautiful facility. Echoes and hard to hear when used for meetings though.
Truly one of the state’s hidden gems
Beautiful place to have a wedding
Beautiful venue! Staff is excellent!
Very nice beautiful place

name: Sun Valley Farm Tour
address: 556 New Cut Rd, Versailles, KY 40383, USA
reviews: My husband & I visited Sun Valley with a group of friends from out-of-town on Sunday afternoon. Brett greeted us immediately as we pulled in & made us feel welcome. We realized he was one of the owners even before he told us because he was so passionate about his work & the horses. Even though he is a young man, he is quite experienced & knowledgeable about the breeding process & the horse industry as a whole. He was always ready to answer our questions & provide additional information when requested. Being able to see & touch the mares & their foals was a wonderful experience for us. As Brett's parents led some horses by, they also greeted us & shared their expertise with us. The farm itself is breathtaking--some of Kentucky's finest, most beautiful rural acreage with a rich history of its own. Everyone in our group thoroughly enjoyed this visit. We highly recommend it to anyone traveling through the area who is interested in horses, history, or just the beauty of our great Commonwealth.
Best tour!! Brett gives a great tour , great information...absolutely book this tour!!

Beautiful horses....beautiful scenery....knowledgeable people.  This farm tour provides tons of information about the thoroughbred industry.  The tour is presented in a very understandable manner.  You leave this place feeling like you have really learned something and your mind is permanently highlighted with some of the most pleasant natural experiences you'll ever have.
What a wonderful tour to see foals, colts and mares and to be educated on the whole process of blood lines for thoroughbreds!!  Brett gave a great tour of a family owned and run operation!
The farm is absolutely breathtaking! The tour was very informative and the family is very kind and welcoming. We also got to see many horses and pet the foals. Overall, incredible experience.

name: Kentucky Horse Park
address: 4089 Iron Works Pkwy, Lexington, KY 40511, USA
reviews: We absolutely loved visiting,  huge area, lots of walking.  We absolutely loved the horse rides. Friendly staff. Super Knowledge and willing to share their Knowledge.  There is plenty of free parking. A wonderful gift shop, plenty of horse memorabilia for purchase.  Beautiful grounds.

First off you will need at least two days to fully take advantage of everything this park has to offer even in off season. I was amazed of how much this place has to offer for a reasonable price. If you have kids this is a excellent place to bring them to not only learn about horses, history,  genealogy, interaction with real horses, but shows too. I would highly recommend this place if you are in town or the area. I live 4 hours away and well worth the drive and money to visit.

Spectacular! So much better than we expected! Just phenomenal! The horse museum is so fantastic! Could spend hours there. So interesting. 

It's a great space, it's really a fun for all ages!

Southern Light Christmas show was fun and creative. Lots of food, animal petting zoo, local merchants booths and a 3 mile course of top notch lights. Very classy and fairly priced. Good family fun. Its an annual program that everyone should attend. The Ky. Horse park provides great community service with this program.

Went during Southern Lights, always enjoy the atmosphere. Cheaper through the week and less waiting in lines for the vendors that offer their  merchandise,  food vendors and the exotic zoo. The zoo is free but you can buy carrots and seed to feed the animals for a reasonable charge of $3.00 and $2.00. Camel rides are also available for a fee. The gift shop offers all types of horse related gifts for the horse lovers on your list. Also, they offer train rides for all to enjoy, no fee for this. And for the train enthusiast, they have several indoor scaled train displays. Some are interactive, some are not. But an enjoyment for all.
 We go every year, have made it a tradition.

name: Keeneland Association Inc
reviews: Heaven on earth! One of my favorite places. So much fun even if you don't bet.  You see all types of folks; so fun to watch people and of course the horses. Such a beautiful place! Great for families too.

Keeneland is a great track. It's very laid back compared to Churchill Downs. The setting is also beautiful tucked into the rolling hills of Lexington. Only problem you'll potentially face is a little traffic, but if you time it right you won't have a problem. Relaxing and beautiful.

I have yet to go to Keenland as a general admission spectator. My first time in April 2019 was through a clubhouse name-on-a-list type deal per Malone's whose GM was supposed to have a box. We weren't given the number so never did end up sitting in a box just clubhouse grandstand. Never ate in the dining room but got dressed up almost for nothing. Really enjoyed Blue Barbecue brisket plate. Now the same venue is only serving the sandwich but it is still really good. During this Fall Meet, we had a reservation in the Paddock dining area. The service took a while but they made up for it in the end. The lunch selections had some traditional foods and great salad options. Non-alcoholic drinks were complimentary. Horse racing and access to the horses was easy. Took in a few races down at the dirt, a couple in the mezzanine, and some from the paddock walk abouts. Also did valet parking and that ran like clockwork, cost $10.
Nice place to walk on a misty morning.  After enjoying breakfast at the Track Kitchen, walk the grounds and watch horses running for practice.  Good food, courteous service, beautiful campus.

I love Keeneland!  If you ever visit Lexington, Kentucky, this is a must do.  You can get so close to the horses and jockeys either up by rails or in the paddock area.  Plus, there are so many ways to bet on the horses and watch the races.  Their food and beverages are great as well.  If you want some more up close and personal behind the scenes experiences, they offer a wide variety of tours for a small fee.  It really is for everyone.  You can spend as much or as little as you want and still have a great time.  Not to be missed!

name: Wild Turkey Distillery
reviews:
Wild Turkey is very conservative Distillery. One of the oldest Distillery in Kentucky and a lots of history you can learn from. Nice facility, modern gift shop, good tour and good tasting.
What the cool thing is you can pick and buy private barrel for under nine grand. 
Don't forget say hello to Jimmy Russell and ask him to sign your bottle.

Did the tour while on vacation. It was nice but the highlight was meeting Jimmy Russell in the gift shop and having him sign a bottle of Single Barrel Rye and getting our pic taken. He talks with you like he's known you for years. Very awesome experience if you are a lover of bourbon.

Nice selection of bourbon products in the gift shop each time I've visited.  Always something available that's not readily available in the local package stores.  Unlike another, very large and popular distillery in the area (cough, cough Sazerac's Buffalo Trace) this gift shop is worth the visit for something unique being available to come home with.  Thank you!

Nice selection of bourbon products in the gift shop each time I've visited.  Always something available that's not readily available in the local package stores.  Unlike another, very large and popular distillery in the area (cough, cough Sazerac's Buffalo Trace) this gift shop is worth the visit for something unique being available to come home with.  Thank you!

Enjoyed seeing the Wild Turkey distillery and loved the gift shop too. Even got an autograph on a W. T. cutting board from the retired owner visiting with “his guests”.  It was great fun. Will go again.

name: Thoroughbred Heritage Horse Farm Tours
address: 1900 Clays Mill Rd, Lexington, KY 40503, USA
reviews: Interesting tour, able to get up close and see the action on the training track Visited another farm and saw this year's Mares and Foals.  Altogether a very worthwhile experience

My husband, a dear friend from Maine, and I took the Thoroughbred Heritage Horse Farm tour on Saturday, November 2.  Our guide was Daniel, and he was amazing!  He was very knowledgeable  about every place we toured, plus he added humor to the tour!  We had a delightful time ending the tour 3.5 hours after starting, and we came away with much more knowledge about horses, the farms, and previous famous horses than when we started!  We highly recommend this tour company.  You won’t regret it!
Very interesting tour to learn more about the industry. Saw some notable races horses and some intriguing facilities. Mike our tour guide was very knowledgeable.

Our Guide was fantastic! We were met promptly, our mini bus was full. He was local so new all the history of Keeneland  Racey, the farms we visited and was a Betologist! Who knew one can be a connoisseur! Our involved visiting the racetrack, stopping by the visiting Budweiser Klidedales, visiting the resting place of Seattle Slew and big money winner Curlin's stud farm. We stopped at Kenny MCpeek's farm and met Curlin's Colt. We made our way past other Kentucky farms.  Remember to tip your Guide!

My husband,  adult daughter,and myself had an amazing time with Vicky a few days ago!  Vicky was so informative and extremely passionate about educating us all about the farms, horses, etc.  It was breathtaking to see Keeneland, the gorgeous farms and the beautiful horses!! I loved being able to get up close and personal with the yearlings and the retirees.  It was a fabulous day that we'll never forget!  Thank you!

name: Bluegrass Distillers
reviews: Great experience. It is a little hard to find, since there aren’t really any signs. It is behind the brewery. You get to fill and label your own bottle.  The tour is short and informative but I would skip it. Just try some bourbons and get your own bottle.
Went last year! Small outfit, but definitely worth a visit! Tour guide was super nice!

Quaint little distillery.  Informative tour and fun to attend.  Learned a lot and met some great folks.  Highly recommend!!!

It is a little hidden though.  Must enter from the back side by the walking trail (Legacy Trail).  Definitely worth seeking it out.

This is as close to a home distilling family run place as you will find. The tour was great for the information and conversations with the female guide. I give the tour experience a 5 star even though the place is small and a bit bootleg.

I give the bourbon a 3 star because I was not too fond of it. I am more of a regular beer drinker but have bourbon or whiskey about once per week. Take it for what it's worth.
Small Craft Distillery. Energetic Justin showed us the operation. We had fun. Let's keep a watch on this one.

name: The Singing Bridge
reviews: Words can't describe this bridge and the virws it offets of the river valley. A must see for anybody.
Wonderful place to sing.

name: Four Roses Distillery
address: 1224 Bonds Mill Rd, Lawrenceburg, KY 40342, USA
reviews: Loved this tour! First off, be sure to make a reservation before as they have limited hours. Also, the ticket price ($10 per adult) includes a free tour at their bottling and warehouse facility in Cox's Creek. The tour lasted about an hour, included a short video about the history of the distillery and walk around the property. After, we went inside and saw the column stills and doubler pot still. My favorite part was seeing all of the old cypress fermentation tanks, with the opportunity to dip your finger in and try them all! The tour concluded with a tasting of their four products, Four Roses, Four Roses Small Batch, Four Roses Single Barrel, and Four Roses Small Batch Select. I enjoyed the Single Barrel and Small Batch Select the most, plus you get to take your tasting glass home! Big shout out to Eileen, she was our guide and did a fantastic job!

Didn't have time to do a tour, so my brother and I decided to do a tasting since we were only familiar with the Single Barrel product that Four Roses puts out.

Eileen led our tasting of all four products and was great. Very informative with the history of Four Roses and also had a lot of knowledge on how each product is made and the different recipes that go in them. Great explanation on how and why each product differed on the nose, palate, and finish. Will ask for her when we come back to do the tour!

After visiting an different distillery, I felt like this was an step down. The most frustrating thing was finding out that the tour was using headphones and microphones, which was fine because I was Deaf and can read lips but a lot of the tour were when the back of his head were facing us. Please add closed captioning/subtitle to the short video at the beginning of the tour and maybe an cheat sheet with numbers of the places we are stopping at and the fun facts that the guide talks about. Ideally I would love to work on creating an Deaf Awareness day where all the distilleries on the trail are interpreted.

Four Roses is fabulous. They are unique and thoughtful. Any event you attend at Four Roses is worth your while. In fact I told my husband last night it’s like a family at Four Roses. Everyone is friendly, helpful and always smiling. If you get the opportunity to meet Brent Elliott or Al Young they are both nice guys that gladly share their time and knowledge with you.

We missed the walking tour, which is on the hour, so we opted for the taste of history (takes about 30 minutes). It was seven dollars to try four bourbons. As a nice added bonus, you get to keep the glass you use to taste.

Fred was very friendly and informative. He even went out of his way to find out what products were available in Australia for the couple that was visiting from there.

Definitely worth checking out this distillery.

name: Equus Run Vineyards
address: 1280 Moores Mill Rd, Midway, KY 40347, USA
reviews: Amazing little vineyard and winery in a beautiful location. I really enjoyed all of the wines, after doing a small tasting of 6 for $7. Bought a bottle of the Farmstead Series Strawberry Wine, as well as Passionate Kiss. Looking forward to the opening of their distillery for Bourbon and Tequila! Very excited to return.
Great local winery. Tastes for all palates from sweet to dry. Beautiful space with areas to sit and enjoy a bottle or go for a walk

Cute little winery on winding country road. It was love at first sip (and I wish I could have been their with mine) with passionate kiss wine. They have an event barn.  The outhouse was something I haven't experienced before at a winery. Very quaint landscape.
The most amazing place.
A favorite place. Good wine, beautiful venue.

name: Evans Orchard and Cider Mill
reviews: Lots of play area for kids. The lines were long which is to be expected, but it was hard to deal with only because it was almost impossible to find out where the line was in the store. There were two different lines. Maybe 3. We had to ask a few customers where the line was before we found the end. Could use a bit more organization on super busy days like today. I love that they had baskets of sunscreen to use for those who forgot it and bubbles for smaller kids who couldn't quite play on all the different areas. My toddler loves the corn box and spent most of his time there. It was nice that it was shaded and had seats for parents to watch. We used the fall fun pass ($12 kids, $5 parents, under2 are free) which gave us access to the playground, hay ride, and corn maze. The hay ride (which doesn't feature any hay, which is nice) takes you out to the pumpkin patch and corn maze. Once you are there you are free to pick a pumpkin and when you get picked up there is a tent to weigh and pay for your pumpkins. 48¢ a pound which is a pretty decent price I feel like. We spent about 5 hours there and we're worn out by the end of it. Worth the money and had a good time! Oh, and the apple cider and donuts were delicious!
Wonderful place for family fun in the fall.  Great selection of apples.  Wonderful cinnamon sugar donuts.  Can't wait to return in 2020.

Got to visit Evans Orchard over the Fall Festival weekend. What a great place for fun.  Plenty of activities for kids and family to enjoy the outdoors.  Wonderful atmosphere.  The lines were long on Saturday as expected, but just glad to be there and experience the warm Fried Apple pies and Peanut Butter Fudge.  Worth the visit everytime !!

THIS A BEST PLACE FOR KIDS TO HAVE A GREATNESS OF FUN, A LITTLE BIT A WAY FROM  DOWNTOWN LEXINGTON. THE ROAD TO THERE, IS EXTRAORDINARILY CLEAN AND NOT CROWDED,  A QUIET PLACE FOR KIDS TO PLAY WITH MANY  GAMES AND FUN RIDES .
THE RESTAURANT IS VERY CROWDED, SO BRING YOUR OWN FOOD IF YOU ARE IN HURRY, OR JUST GET ON LINE EARLIER OR JUST BE PATIENT AND STAY ON THE LINE BECAUSE IT GOES FAST.
BE THERE, ON TIME, AND PAY FOR YOUR  ADMISSION FEE, IS CHARGED FAIRLY BUT YOUR ARE NOT CAN GET IN  WITHOUT IT.
THE KIDS ARE VERY HAPPY AND DON'T WANT TO LIVE SO BE PREPARED FOR IT.

I was visiting family in the Lexington area and they took me here.  What a lovely way to spend a fall day.  Pumpkins everywhere!  Delicious fudge! Great place to take the kids as there is a playground, a trampoline-like device and various other activities.   Plenty of parking.

name: Masterson Station Park
reviews: Still a work in progress, the children's park is great. However, lots of empty space that hasn't reached it's full "park" potential. We enjoy walking it, but super dangerous crossing to trail that goes across Leestown Rd. This really could be "the best" Lexington Park but we just aren't there yet. Nearby residents can only hope.
Such a wonderful place to bring the horses! All the other riders are so friendly and helpful, and it’s such a great atmosphere with tons of space to hack and see the sights!

Dog Park.  Water fountains for the dogs was nice to see and 2 large areas for them to play.  Good to see clean up bags provided and the park looked clean.  Nice job on the upkeep by providers and users. 👍🐕🐩
We enjoy our visits to the soccer fields at Masterson Station and the girls finished their season strong with a W! ⚽️ The park is well kept and clean. We have plans to visit the dog park soon.
Great place for family and friends to come together and have fun! Lots of places to hike and love the Soccer fields.

name: Rebecca Ruth Candy Tours & Museum
reviews: Best Chocolate Covered Bourbon Balls anywhere. The other treats are pretty good, too. Friendly staff working the shop are ready and willing to help you find exactly what you need. Plenty of parking available. Be sure to ask about a bag of “Boo Boos.”
Great customer service, and the candy is soooooo good. I am from Utah and I will be ordering candy from here now. Nothing like this place.

We are on vacation when we drove by and saw the sign for Bourbon Candy. I insisted we stop and I’m so glad we did. The woman working inside was such a delight and told us the history of the candy store. I’m so glad we stopped and Can’t wait to eat all the sweets!
Cute lil store and shop! My parents named me after this store 58 yrs ago. Such variety of candies. The tour is very interesting as well. They also provide mailing of their candies around the world!
Had a nice tour of the Rebecca Ruth candy store and Museum. Such wonderful history. Our 6 year old granddaughter even enjoyed. Course the chocolate sample she got at the end didnt hurt.

name: McConnell Springs
reviews:
This is one of my favorite trails when taking little kids. 
I absolutely love that they have a full trail that is pavement. 
Though everything looks prettier in the spring after it's bloomed, it still is nice to get out and enjoy nature. 
I love that there are so many signs that explain the history. I love the exhibits on the inside building as well. There is a nice picnic area to eat and trash cans. 
I love the sign-in sheet so they can find us if something was to happen. 
There are so many wonderful things about this trail.

A nice Walking Park would not call it a hike. It is very similar to the arboretum in regards to plant life and paved walking path. NOT A HIKE. The park is to close to industrial complexes causing tons of noise pollution. Otherwise a nice place tons of history and gorgeous water in creeks.
The springs are beautiful. A lot of work has been done on the park recently. The viewing platform at Final Sink is very nice.

This was a really cool stop I just wish I went there in the Spring or Summer when it was warmer. One thing you will notice right away is that the people working there are so ridiculously nice it's amazing. Also they have a really great indoor learning facility with live animals, fossils, bones, skins and more. The trails are really well pathed so even people with wheelchairs, crutches and walkers can enjoy it no problem. This is a wonderful way to get out of the car and stretch your legs and give the kids a way burn off some energy that's both entertaining and educational.
Beautiful, well maintained trails.  Although in the fall/winter you can easily see signs of factories through the trees

name: Kentucky River Tours
address: 100 Great Buffalo Trace, Frankfort, KY 40601, USA
reviews: My wife and I booked an outing on the river and had the pleasure of meeting both Captains Allison and Nathan. From start to finish the experience was fantastic! From an easy pick up and drop off at the buffalo trace distillery to a very welcoming and knowledgeable boat tour on the Kentucky river. If you’re looking for something a little different in bourbon country yet still relaxing then this is a must do excursion! Can’t wait to come back and do it again!

Captains Allison and Nathan are both great! They took us on a beautiful tour of Frankfort's Kentucky River. They showed us lots of points of interest and catered to our 3 year-old's love of turtles by slowing down the boat so she could see them sunbathing. The boat was pristine and had all of the necessary safety equipment. I would highly recommend this adventure!

A fantastic new experience in Frankfort, KY that is great for both adults and kids.   We thoroughly enjoyed the view and the stories. Visit Frankfort and take this fun, informative tour of the Kentucky River!
Great tour!! Capt Nathan is awesome!! Friendly and accommodating.

We loved this tour on the river. It was an amazing day with lots of information. We enjoyed the ride to the boat and the boat trip equally, everyone was so fun to be around. We will definatly recommend it to anyone passing through or hanging out in Frankfort again.

name: Bluegrass Scenic Railroad and Museum
reviews:
The right side of the train has all the views. This is why I only give it three stars. The right side of the train is where we took most of our photos. Sit on the RIGHT  side of the train!!!

Other than that we loved the ride. Free water and bookmarker at the end of the train ride before returning was a plus thanks to the Volunteers. Very nice people. Very nice. 

Except

The only other thing I disliked. Is that even though we were in line. People tried cutting in front of us to get better seats. Even though we had arrived on time and had time to look around and waited. People started running to the conductor to get inside. Even though the Conductor was "Yelling Open AIR only" people who started to arrive in first class tried to board the train. I paid for First class and I arrived 45 minutes before like it stated online. Before it started and had a few people try to move us out of the way. They should board people by time of arrival, let the people who have been waiting longer in the HEAT, get on first. It was 90 degrees today. Not to add, people need to switch sides/seats so other people can get a better view since the right side has all the views.

We loved the ride (in the first class air conditioned car.  The only limitation of the entire experience is the fact that it seemed too short (and we understand the track is safe only so far).  However, the value for the price per person is exceptional.
A nice Museum and about an hour or so train ride up to a closed bridge and back. Good place to spend some time and see some railroad memorabilia.
Very enjoyable experience & fun for the whole family. Great bunch of volunteers working there, very friendly & informative about the trip as well. We will be back!

It was fun with my family and my son absolutely loved the experience... Definitely recommend is good for autistic children or was with mine... The only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is the day we went we booked 1st class  but due to technical difficulties with the generator that runs the A.C we had to step down to second class. In no way was it their falt nor do I blame them the staff was real nice but it... The ride was enjoyable and you get to see some of the stables and stuff for the pure breed horses as well...

name: Mary Todd Lincoln House
address: 578 W Main St, Lexington, KY 40507, USA
reviews: A gem right in the heart of downtown Lexington.  Enthusiastic and knowledgable staff. The house is well kept and beautifully decorated.  Attended for their President's Day event and there was so much to do.  Great activities for the kids in each room with good interaction and a fun way to learn about history.

Went there to see one of the authentic places that Mary Todd Lincoln grew up in. It did not disappoint. We were taken on a tour through the house and shown their amazing collection. The tour guide was knowledgeable and shared many details about the family history. Would recommend for any history buff looking for an interesting excursion in Lexington!

This tour was so education and informational. The home is has furniture from the Todd family, passed down through the generations that eventually returned back to the family home, and other pieces from the time period. 

The tour guides are very knowledgeable and happy to answer questions, even from the youngest guests on the tour.

While in Lexington touring the University of Kentucky, My son and I, toured the Mary Todd Lincoln Home!  It was very interesting! Our tour guide was very informative and knowledgeable. The home, which contained beautiful relics  (many original) gave a sense of how life may have been back in those days! My favorite part was using the homes original staircase, and touching the stair railing which was  touched by Mary Todd Lincoln, and quite possibly Abraham Lincoln!
Very interesting.  Lovely home. nice visit

name: Ashland - The Henry Clay Estate
reviews: Beautiful inside and out.  The garden is stunning when in full bloom, and the home tour is something every Lexingtonian should experience at least once.  A lot has been done to make the grounds more appealing in recent years, including all the giant steel sculptures, mulched walking paths, and other interesting art and exhibits.  They've also tried to attract different markets and age groups by offering events such as yoga on the lawn.  The employees are not the nicest you've ever encountered, which has dissuaded me from taking others on the tour, but there's so much to see that one aspect shouldn't deter you.  The grounds have lots of historic aspects, too.
Great tour, but didn’t realize not Henry Clay’s house. It was torn down by son and rebuilt on same foundation. So, the same room, but not really. That said, still a very nice historic house.

For history lovers, this is a very interesting place to see. I really enjoyed viewing the original coach Henry Clay used traveling back and forth to Washington. Seeing. Furniture from the 1800s and the beauty of the Mansion itself ensures a worthwhile trip! Make a point to check out the formal Garden!

The grounds are a great place for my 3 year old to run around and discover nature. Unfortunately the tour is not suitable for kids her age. Too many boundaries and not interesting enough for her. Good for adults, though.
Unfortunately it was closed when we got there. Looks very interesting for any history buff.

name: Aviation Museum of Kentucky
reviews: Really nice sized aviation museum.  They have more planes than you would think.  Took my 5 year old daughter and her friend.  They loved seeing the planes, sitting in a helicopter, playing a flight sim game.  Perfect for an hour or two.  For the big kids, aka Dad, they have about 5 or 6 fighter jets and tons of planes from many different decades.  Most notably for me is a F-14 Tomcat.  It has been there since 2005, but it never gets old seeing one of the largest fighter planes ever made.  Truly amazing engineering.  Take a couple hours on a Saturday or Sunday afternoon and check out the much overlooked Aviation Museum of KY, it's right by Bluegrass airport.  $10 adults, $7 6-17, under 6 free.  If you like aviation at any level, you won't regret it.
A wonderful museum! My brother and I went and the staff was very knowledgeable and interested in talking to us about the planes. Had a wonderful time and loved the little plane earrings they sell!!

Staff was extremely friendly and informative. Most of them are volunteers. It doesn't seem like they change the exhibits regularly. It was cool sitting inside of a Cessna 150 and a Bell helicopter. Many different types of aircraft and articles. Took about 1 hour to see everything if you take your time. Two separate rooms house all of the exhibits. Check it out!
Interesting displays and great, knowledgeable staff. We'll be coming back!

Happily surprised and really enjoyed this museum inside their is a helicopter and small airplane you can get inside and with working pressable buttons and you have to try the flight simulator. I also need to mention the very kind friendly knowledgeable employees working there.

name: Waveland State Historic Site
address: 225 Waveland Museum Ln, Lexington, KY 40514, USA
reviews: We didn't actually tour the house (yet) but visited Santa in the barn. He was just perfect! The barn was magically decorated and the kids had such a sweet experience. Thank you for offering this special gift to the public! The grounds even in winter are lovely. We will definitely be back in the spring to do a true tour.

Was part of the ghost hunt on 10/25/2019. Fabulous experience.  Wonderful and beautiful place. I had an experience with a spirit and an EVP I will never forget. Thank you to all the staff members who helped me along the way.  Where's the footage? 😉
We did the ghost tour.  Way too many people on the tour.  Was more touristy then expected.  We would have preferred using our own equipment and being by ourselves with a tour guide.

We visited on a day of what had been billed as a large arts and craft fair with food trucks and tours.  There was a coffee truck, a pizza truck and a barbecue truck.  Not a big selection. Tours of the house were shortened but informative and guides were well versed in the history of this old hemp plantation. I was also expecting a larger turnout of art vendors --so this was a little disappointing.  
The old house is beautiful and full of Kentucky history making it worth the entry fee and visit.
Went for Christmas Tea in a group of 4. It was truly magical. The volunteers did such an amazing job

name: Castle & Key Distillery
reviews: My family was visiting from out of town and were looking to tour one of Kentucky's many distilleries. The other distilleries that we looked at were either booked or closed on Sundays. Luckily, we stumbled on Castle and Key. We arrived early and got drinks at the bar. The bartender (Jordan) was super friendly and obviously very knowledgeable. The drinks were excellent (coming from someone who doesn't normally drink gin.) The tour was a ton of fun. The distillery has such an interesting history behind it and our tour guide, Russell, was an excellent host. I would highly recommend Castle and Key and can't wait to try their bourbon once its ready.

Fabulous place, authentic & true to their mission to preserve a beautiful storied site and produce high quality spirits to match.  Well worth the trip, a standout in an area with many tour options.  

We brought our family here today and did the 1.5 hour tour.  The tour was led by Richard and Russell and provided great insight into their spirit production and extensive access to the full site with history and insight into the preservation efforts.  The buildings were beautiful and almost stuck in time in the best way possible.  Their bar, event space, and welcome areas are gorgeous and were thoughtfully furnished.  They also have well designed outdoor spaces perfect for nicer weather.  We also were lucky enough to meet Rick Key, their resident rescue cat who is sweet and adorable - he is worth the ticket alone.   

Their team was passionate about the site’s history and focus on quality spirits.  Everyone was very welcoming throughout our visit.  The tour finished with a very intimate and creative tasting of their vodka and gin - both were delicious and we typically do not enjoy clear spirits.  They have their first bourbon (fingers crossed) releasing in 2022.  Unlike other distilleries they are not releasing branded bourbon from other producers and are focusing solely on their own production with bottled in bond products - very promising things to come!

I booked this experience for my girlfriend and I. We had a great time, our tour guide Tony was great and very knowledgeable. We met two other couples on the tour and we all had a great experience. We can’t wait to come back in the spring when the weather is a little warmer. We heard there are talks of turning the old administration building into a hotel/bed and breakfast, and maybe even a rooftop bar! We hope to see progress on that the next time we come back. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a personalized distillery experience!

A fantastic place to see... From the guided tour to the cocktails afterward, I would highly recommend it.  Suggest taking the 1 and 1/2 hour tour.  There is so much history steeped within the walls and on the grounds. This is definitely a place to go if you’ve never been and/or to take visitors from out of town/State that are interested in bourbon, gin and vodka distilling.  There is also a lovely sunken Garden and much more to see and learn while being there!   Two thumbs up!!

Tour host is the best I’ve ever had.  Tour showed the  full circle that bourbon 🥃 industry has taken.  To see the restoration of this property is amazing.   Future looks bright for this company. Best tour I’ve ever done.  I’ve almost finished entire bourbon trail and definitely suggest this  visit.

name: Ark Encounter
address: 1 Ark Encounter Dr, Williamstown, KY 41097, USA
reviews: Absolutely amazing. Adults will appreciate it more than the kids but if they know the story they will love it as well. So much to see and so many people there trying to see it. You need to give yourself a couple of days to see everything without over tiring yourself and to assure you get to see it all.  The crowds can get large so reading the exhibits can be tricky that's a good reason to try to see it over a couple days instead of one long day.  Lines moved very quick to get in and on a shuttle to the Ark. Landscaping is awesome outside of the Ark providing several picture perfect photo shots. Handicap friendly.  The kids will get tired as it is allot to see. The small petting mini zoo like areas outside are very hot though with limited shade, small cramped areas for the animals to walk around in and little to no seating to rest your tired legs. The snack shops outside of the Ark were not open so cannot review those.  The Ark's gift shop is wonderful with so many options of things to purchase. Prices aren't cheap but neither is the quality of the items. A great place to visit but wear comfortable shoes, and pace yourself.

Everything I thought it would be and more. This is a one-of-a-kind exhibit, a must-see. The park grounds are well-maintained, the staff is professional, friendly and helpful, and the guests are very friendly as well; everyone works together to keep the place clean and family friendly. I loved the buffet and really enjoyed the zoo. I would recommend this place for religious and non-religious people alike. Great place to take your family in Kentucky! 😁👍

The most amazing experience. Well worth the money. I do highly recommend getting there first thing so you can truly enjoy everything they have to experience. Puts such an awesome realization of what Noah and his family were able to accomplish. Makes the Bible that much more real! 

I am planning on saving up to bring my children there. It is a once in a lifetime experience that should be experienced more than once!!!!

This is definitely worth seeing in person. It’s incredible that such a large ship could be built before modern day technologies and machines. I’ll admit too, I didn’t realize Noah had Dinosaurs on the ship. So many animals and so many different species. Its amazing Noah and his family could take care of all of them. It must have been exhausting for them. Not to mention, the smell they must have dealt with. 

We visited during the off season so there were parts not open but the ship is the main attraction, so it didn’t bother us that we only saw the ship. 

The only thing that did disappoint us was the lack of food choices. Only the restaurant was open, which is a buffet and very expensive for someone who doesn’t want a lot to eat. I would have rather spent money on food from the other spots where you can buy smaller portions cheaper. However, with that said, the buffet food was good. Not worth the money good though. 

As a side note, we stayed at the Hampton Inn a couple exits away from the Ark. If you want somewhere to stay within minutes of this place, I highly recommend that hotel.

It is a great place to take the family.  Walking into the Ark you get a wow factor just seeing how enormous it is.  They explain evolution vs. creation and give so much data explaining the two arguments.  It is very well done.

name: Thoroughbred Park
reviews: Fun for the kids to run around and see the bronze statues.  Details on the statues were so fine, actual clothing and tack might have have been dipped in bronze  Maybe the jockeys too....
I like to go here for a quick walk.
Really pretty, the horse statues are incredible, great place to stop & take a few selfies lol
This is a lovely park.  I see a few people speak of climbing on the horses.  These are pieces of artwork.... not playground equipment! Enjoy them as the pieces of art that they are.

Nice little park. 
Cool horse statues, I think that's what you'd call them.
And a water fountain that you're not supposed to swim in but people do.

name: Yuko-En on the Elkhorn
reviews: This is a great place to ho and just walk around with your family, a significant other, or alone. Depending on what mood you are in. It is beautiful and peaceful. Been here many times. One of my favorite places to go when i just need calm

This park is beautiful, especially in the Spring with red buds, dog wood and other flowers in full bloom.  With all the water and rocks, it is a very relaxing place.  The only negative is the parking area with pot holes.  The city should repair it.
Beautiful tranquil place to visit.
This is nice but the bathrooms were closed and the property needs up keep.
Beautiful place to watch the sunrise and calm your mind

name: Jacobson Park
address: 4001 Athens Boonesboro Rd, Lexington, KY 40509, USA
reviews: I love this park. It's absolutely beautiful and full of wildlife. During the summer there are lots of families, but the park is so large it never really feels crowded. If you play pokemon go, there are plenty of stops and gyms. The park is also dog-friendly, which I really appreciated. You can rent out a paddle boat, go fishing, or host a picnic. It's a really nice place.

Our favorite park in town. During the summer time, we go to the splash pad, where the kids love to get wet and have fun. They also have an enormous playground area, with separate areas for young and older children. We've been going to this park since our kids were infants. I don't see us stopping any time soon. Pro tip: Don't chase the ducks!

I work in that area. I was not actually at the park. Its quaint from the road as you pass by. It looks like a safe place to take kids and pets. The neighboring businesses and homes are all well kept. Also there are sone good quality places to eat.
Our dog loves the dog park here. Always friends to play with. Parking is very easy too.
Love going to Jacobson Park Big Lake you can fish kids can play. Just an all-around good time.

name: Scott County Park
address: 1260 Scott County Park Rd, Georgetown, KY 40324, USA
reviews: Love this park. Took my kids when they were little. Now my grandkids. So much for them to do. Public bathrooms to. The park is also free to the public.

I wasn’t overly impressed with the park generally.  I was impressed the the powerful force the river had become because of the rains we had been experiencing.  The water was 2 feet higher than normal, making an exciting visit.  I want to go back under normal conditions to better rate the park.

Great place to take your kids to play. Lots of area to run around,  nice play ground  and a good walking trail around it. Also has to small ponds to fish in. Baseball fields, tennis courts,  basketball court...plenty to do
Very beautiful and clean, quite and not alot of traffic the further back you go. Great place to take your dogs.
Great place to get some fresh air. Plenty of open space and jogging paths The two ponds are stocked with several fish species. Great for catfish, bluegills and trout.

name: Shillito Park
address: 300 W Reynolds Rd, Lexington, KY 40503, USA
reviews: Have been going to this park since I was a little kid. Back when everything was old. I love this park with all my heart, definitely a great place to go for picnics, summer events, sports with friends, or even walks with pets. Beautiful park and full of life. Highly recommend
Excellent design, quality, environment, and clean. Bathrooms on site.

Very nice park. Layout is easy to navigate. Running / Walking trail around the park. Lots of open fields to play soccer, football, baseball, or any other outdoor activities. Big restrooms and lots of parking!
I enjoy the walking path which winds among trees for much of its length. Also it is a family park with people of all ages.

Today I had an appointment to see this apartment complex for the 3rd time. I show up and there is no one there. The office was locked and a note saying they would be back at 5pm and we had an appointment at 4:30. The first time they called before the appointment to cancel because they double booked and had someone moving in at the same time then rescheduled for the next Saturday and they called again saying they had someone moving in. Now for the 3rd time they never called or anything and no one was there. The communication has been horrible and it has been so frustrating to try to see this apartment complex. Don't recommend.

name: The Living Arts & Science Center
address: 362 N Martin Luther King Blvd, Lexington, KY 40508, USA
reviews: My son had a field trip here today and it was great , they have so many hands on activities and so many things for kids to learn! All of the kids had fun and recommend that other kids come check it out, I asked the kids what part was their favorite over half said the habitat exhibit , and the rest liked the area where they made paper bats. (The animal lol) I would definitely encourage you to bring your children here!
Awesome art classes. Gallery space. Science exhibits! And a planetarium!!

I do yoga here with Cindy Reed, she owns the Massage and Yoga studio in Dudley square. I love her, I love the yoga. And I love the yoga here on Sunday mornings at 10am. $5 a class. 
The Living Arts venue is super supportive, and they offer So Many Neat things to do! For kids and adults. Check them out for sure!
The planetarium was amazing! Everyone was so knowledgeable and kind! Free to wander around and totally worth checking out.

A great local science museum with various monthly exhibits. Very hands on and interactive with the artwork and the science, great for kids of all ages. One of the best things about the LASC is the planetarium. It houses the only planetarium in Lexington within a 25 mile radius.
